meanings.definition: Making a harsh, high-pitched sound when moved or pressure is applied.
meanings.sent1: The old door was creeky when opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The creeky stairs echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent3: The creeky chair seemed to complain with every movement.
meanings.sent4: The creeky floorboards whispered secrets with each step.
meanings.sent5: The creeky gate sang a rusty tune in the wind.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, high-pitched sound when moved or pressure is applied.
meanings.sent1: She carefully creekyed the rusty hinges back to life.
meanings.sent2: The old swing creekyed as the children played on it.
meanings.sent3: He creekyed the door open, trying not to wake anyone.
meanings.sent4: The branches creekyed in the wind like a haunted choir.
meanings.sent5: The old bicycle creekyed as he pedaled down the street.
